result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward John Tobin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Restitution set at $5,000.00 payable to 
Anciilla Domini Sisters, Inc.; $141,037.83 payable to The Religious and Charitable Risk Pooling Trust of the Brothers of the Christian Schools and Affiliates to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Defendant to pay the $5,000.00 before any other restitution.

-Court WAIVES all Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments due to the large amount of restitution owed. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Pay all supervision fees

-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No contact with 
3601 S. 41st Street

-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Edward John Tobin in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Edward John Tobin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for  4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, with credit for 100 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
 -Restitution set at $5,000.00 payable to Anciilla Domini Sisters, Inc.; $141,037.83 payable to The Religious and Charitable Risk Pooling Trust of the Brothers of the Christian Schools and Affiliates to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Defendant to pay the $5,000.00 before any other restitution.  
-Court WAIVES all Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments due to the large amount of restitution owed. 
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No contact with 3601 S. 41st Street 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Defendant Edward John Tobin in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Edward John Tobin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Filed:  Victim impact statements and restitution worksheets.  Court adjourns the sentencing hearing to allow defense time to review documents filed today. Defendant remains REMANDED.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court, defendant Edward John Tobin not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant as been served with the bench warrant and is in the custody of the Sheriff's Department.    Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 19.
NO REPLY FROM SURETYOR DEFENDANT
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Terese M. Dick in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in Court for Bail/bond hearing, Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court ordered Sentencing date of 6/9/15 vacated.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Parties contacted to schedule bail review.  Bail review scheduled for 04/10/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Edward John Tobin in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Edward John Tobin in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Edward John Tobin in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Brandon Wigley for Irene Parthum.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point.

15RM002099  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-16-2015

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 3601 S 41ST ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Edward John Tobin in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Edward John Tobin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
